This page lists all '''quests''' in ''[Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire](/pillarsOfEternityIiDeadfire/)''. {{DISPLAYTITLE:''Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire'' quests}} ## Main quests Following the destruction of [Caed Nua](/caedNua/) by [Eothas](/eothas/), who occupied the adra statue devoted to [Maros Nua](/marosNua/), the Watcher ends up with a maimed soul and a desperate need to find the god to save his soul and himself. However, they will find out more than they bargained with, as with their hunt for [Thaos](/thaos/). ###### The Hunt for Eothas * [Prologue](/prologue/): After [Eothas](/eothas/) awakens in [Maros Nua](/marosNua/)'s titan and destroys [Caed Nua](/caedNua/), the Watcher awakens in [the Beyond](/theBeyond/). * [Stranded](/stranded/): The storm hurls you against [Vilario's Rest](/vilariosRest/) and you need to figure out how to get off the island to hunt the god of light. * [To Hunt a God](/toHuntAGod/): You need to figure out how to hunt the god as well. * [The Veins of Eora](/theVeinsOfEora/): Luminous adra matters to Eothas - and to you. Find a way to locate them, so that you can commune with Eothas. * [A Distant Light](/aDistantLight/): Investigate [Hasongo](/hasongo/), which recently witnessed the god's passing. * [He Waits in Fire](/heWaitsInFire/): Follow Eothas up [Ashen Maw](/ashenMaw/) in [Magran's Teeth](/magransTeeth/) and confront him. * [The Coming Storm](/theComingStorm/): Find a way to navigate through [Ondra's Mortar](/ondrasMortar/). * [The City Lost to Time](/theCityLostToTime/): Confront Eothas at [Ukaizo](/ukaizo/). ## =End = {{See|Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire endings}} ## Side quests These are miscellaneous quests which are not vital to the main storyline. {| class="wikitable sortable" ! and Branch](/rootAndBranch/) * [The Seeds of Deception](/theSeedsOfDeception/) ## Quest level The quest level as shown in the journal (by hovering over the the book icon under the quest title) gives the player an indication of the relative difficulty of the quest in relation to their level. The base quest level is manually set by the game designers. Although this level doesn't actually influence any gameplay mechanics itself, it generally takes into account (and is therefore a good indicator of): * The average level of creatures, enemies and traps encountered, in areas related to the quest. This is expressed as a location's "expected player level" (also called "recommended level"). The quest level averages out to be around the same level as the locations prominently featured. * The difficulty of dialogue checks. If the quest level is equal to the player's level, the difficulty of the quest will be as close to as it was originally designed, generally meaning that enemies faced will be close to the player's level, and dialogue checks will be generally passable. Note that the quest level is adjusted with [Level scaling](/levelScaling/) in order to match the perceived difficulty of areas/encounters and in turn the enemies found within the quest, though the quest level itself does not affect scaling whatsoever. This should be kept in mind, as the quest pages on the wiki list the base/unscaled quest level - not one that is adjusted. ## Quest experience {{See|Experience and advancement#Quest experience}} [ ](/categoryPillarsOfEternityIiDeadfireQuests/)

The base quest level is manually set by the game designers. Although this level doesn't actually influence any gameplay mechanics itself, it generally takes into account (and is therefore a good indicator of): * The average level of creatures, enemies and traps encountered, in areas related to the quest. This is expressed as a location's "expected player level" (also called "recommended level"). The quest level averages out to be around the same level as the locations prominently featured. * The difficulty of dialogue checks. If the quest level is equal to the player's level, the difficulty of the quest will be as close to as it was originally designed, generally meaning that enemies faced will be close to the player's level, and dialogue checks will be generally passable. Note that the quest level is adjusted with [[Level scaling]] in order to match the perceived difficulty of areas/encounters and in turn the enemies found within the quest, though the quest level itself does not affect scaling whatsoever. This should be kept in mind, as the quest pages on the wiki list the base/unscaled quest level - not one that is adjusted. ==Quest experience== {{See|Experience and advancement#Quest experience}} [[Category:Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire quests| ]]
